elements.content: Two new network solids containing mercury ions are reported. The structure of HgCl4·H2tpt·H2O (tpt = 1,3,5-tri(4-pyridyl)-2,4,6-triazine) contains H2tpt2+ cations connected into 1D zigzag chains via hydrogen bonding between protonated and unprotonated pyridyl groups of adjacent cations. The third pyridyl group of each H2tpt2+ cation is also protonated and hydrogen-bonds to tetrahedral HgCl4 2- anions that lie as appendages to the main hydrogen-bonded chain. (HgCl2)2(hmt) (hmt = hexamethylenetetramine) contains HgCl2 and hmt molecules. The mercury is pseudo-octahedral, coordinating to two trans chloride ligands (Hg−Cl = 2.351(1) Å) and making four much longer equatorial interactions with hmt molecules (Hg−N = 2.735(4) Å) and adjoining HgCl2 molecules (Hg−Cl = 3.105(1) Å). The long Hg−N interactions link the two species into 2D (4,4) sheets, while long Hg−Cl interactions connect these sheets into an overall 3D network through chains of rhombohedral Hg−Cl···Hg−Cl··· motifs.
elements.clean_text: Two new network solids containing mercury ions are reported. The structure of HgCl4⋅H2tpt⋅H2O (tpt = 1,3,5-tri(4-pyridyl)-2,4,6-triazine) contains H2tpt2+ cations connected into 1D zigzag chains via hydrogen bonding between protonated and unprotonated pyridyl groups of adjacent cations. The third pyridyl group of each H2tpt2+ cation is also protonated and hydrogen-bonds to tetrahedral HgCl4 2- anions that lie as appendages to the main hydrogen-bonded chain. (HgCl2)2(hmt) (hmt = hexamethylenetetramine) contains HgCl2 and hmt molecules. The mercury is pseudo-octahedral, coordinating to two trans chloride ligands (Hg-Cl = 2.351(1) Å) and making four much longer equatorial interactions with hmt molecules (Hg-N = 2.735(4) Å) and adjoining HgCl2 molecules (Hg-Cl = 3.105(1) Å). The long Hg-N interactions link the two species into 2D (4,4) sheets, while long Hg-Cl interactions connect these sheets into an overall 3D network through chains of rhombohedral Hg-Cl⋅⋅⋅Hg-Cl⋅⋅⋅ motifs.

elements.content: The structure of HgCl4·H2tpt·H2O (tpt = 1,3,5-tri(4-pyridyl)-2,4,6-triazine) contains hydrogen-bonded 1D zigzag chains of H2tpt2+ molecules and HgCl4 2- anions which also hydrogen-bond to the H2tpt2+ cations. (HgCl2)2(hmt) (hmt = hexamethylenetetramine) contains HgCl2 and hmt molecules which generate 2D (4,4) sheets through long Hg−N interactions; longer Hg−Cl interactions further connect the sheets into 3D networks.
elements.clean_text: The structure of HgCl4⋅H2tpt⋅H2O (tpt = 1,3,5-tri(4-pyridyl)-2,4,6-triazine) contains hydrogen-bonded 1D zigzag chains of H2tpt2+ molecules and HgCl4 2- anions which also hydrogen-bond to the H2tpt2+ cations. (HgCl2)2(hmt) (hmt = hexamethylenetetramine) contains HgCl2 and hmt molecules which generate 2D (4,4) sheets through long Hg-N interactions; longer Hg-Cl interactions further connect the sheets into 3D networks.

elements.content: Crystal engineering of metal-containing networks has to date focused mainly on first-row transition metals, Zn, Cd, and Ag. We report here two new networks constructed with mercuric chloride and nitrogen-donor heterocyclic ligands.
elements.clean_text:
Introduction

Crystal engineering of metal-containing networks has to date focused mainly on first-row transition metals, Zn, Cd, and Ag. We report here two new networks constructed with mercuric chloride and nitrogen-donor heterocyclic ligands.

elements.content: The first ligand is 1,3,5-tri(4-pyridyl)-2,4,6-triazine (tpt), which we have previously used to construct a number of highly symmetrical coordination polymers. This essentially planar ligand contains three trigonally arranged pyridyl donor groups, and in all but three structures all three pyridyl donors coordinate to metal ions.
elements.clean_text: The first ligand is 1,3,5-tri(4-pyridyl)-2,4,6-triazine (tpt), which we have previously used to construct a number of highly symmetrical coordination polymers. This essentially planar ligand contains three trigonally arranged pyridyl donor groups, and in all but three structures all three pyridyl donors coordinate to metal ions.

elements.content:

</fig>

The second ligand is hexamethylenetetramine (hmt), which has also been used by a number of groups to construct coordination polymers with interesting topologies. This roughly spherical ligand contains four tetrahedrally arranged amine donors and forms a wide range of structures, with anywhere between none to all four amine nitrogens coordinating to metal atoms.
elements.clean_text: The second ligand is hexamethylenetetramine (hmt), which has also been used by a number of groups to construct coordination polymers with interesting topologies. This roughly spherical ligand contains four tetrahedrally arranged amine donors and forms a wide range of structures, with anywhere between none to all four amine nitrogens coordinating to metal atoms.

elements.content: Synthesis of HgCl 4 ·H 2 tpt·H 2 O (1). A buffer zone containing n-propanol (5 mL) and 1,1,2,2-tetrachloroethane (5 mL) was carefully layered on a solution of tpt (25 mg, 0.08 mmol) in 1,1,2,2-tetrachloroethane (5 mL). A third solution of HgCl2 (22 mg, 0.08 mmol) in n-propanol (5 mL) was then carefully layered on top of the buffer layer. After several days, clear colorless crystals formed (22 mg, 40%). IR (KBr, cm-1):  3486 (m), 3074 (m), 1548 (s), 1505 (vs), 1373 (vs), 800 (s). Anal. Calcd for C18H16Cl4HgN6O:  C, 32.04; H, 2.39; N, 12.45. Found:  C, 31.16; H, 1.95; N, 12.30.
elements.clean_text:
Experimental Section

 Synthesis of HgCl  4  ⋅H  2  tpt⋅H  2  O (1). A buffer zone containing n-propanol (5 mL) and 1,1,2,2-tetrachloroethane (5 mL) was carefully layered on a solution of tpt (25 mg, 0.08 mmol) in 1,1,2,2-tetrachloroethane (5 mL). A third solution of HgCl2 (22 mg, 0.08 mmol) in n-propanol (5 mL) was then carefully layered on top of the buffer layer. After several days, clear colorless crystals formed (22 mg, 40%). IR (KBr, cm-1): 3486 (m), 3074 (m), 1548 (s), 1505 (vs), 1373 (vs), 800 (s). Anal. Calcd for C18H16Cl4HgN6O: C, 32.04; H, 2.39; N, 12.45. Found: C, 31.16; H, 1.95; N, 12.30.

elements.content: Synthesis of (HgCl 2 ) 2 (hmt) (2). Reaction of HgCl2 (224 mg, 0.825 mmol) and hmt (79 mg, 0.564 mmol) in a 1:1 mixture of water and methanol (20 mL) gave clear colorless needles of 2 (222 mg, 79%). IR (KBr, cm-1):  1460 (m), 1382 (w), 1334 (w), 1233 (s), 1002 (s), 806 (s), 706 (w), 676 (s), 506 (m). Anal. Calcd for C6H12Cl4Hg2N4:  C, 10.55; H, 1.77; N, 8.20. Found:  C, 10.53; H, 1.76; N, 8.23.
elements.clean_text: Synthesis of (HgCl  2  )  2  (hmt) (2). Reaction of HgCl2 (224 mg, 0.825 mmol) and hmt (79 mg, 0.564 mmol) in a 1:1 mixture of water and methanol (20 mL) gave clear colorless needles of 2 (222 mg, 79%). IR (KBr, cm-1): 1460 (m), 1382 (w), 1334 (w), 1233 (s), 1002 (s), 806 (s), 706 (w), 676 (s), 506 (m). Anal. Calcd for C6H12Cl4Hg2N4: C, 10.55; H, 1.77; N, 8.20. Found: C, 10.53; H, 1.76; N, 8.23.

elements.content: Crystallography. Crystal data and details of the structure determinations are presented in Table . Data were collected at 123(2) K on a Nonius KappaCCD diffractometer using Mo Kα radiation (λ = 0.710 73 Å). Absorption corrections (face-indexed) were applied to both 1 (minimum/maximum transmission factors 0.1723/0.3042) and 2 (0.0899/0.2989). Solutions were obtained by direct methods using SHELXS-97, and the structures were refined against |F 2| using SHELXL-97. All non-hydrogen atoms were refined anisotropically. The hydrogen atoms bonded to the nitrogen atoms of the pyridyls in 1, which are involved in hydrogen bonding, were refined freely with isotropic thermal parameters, while no hydrogen atoms were assigned to the water molecules. All other hydrogens in both structures were included at calculated positions but not refined. One of the chloride ligands in 1 is disordered over two positions (Cl1A and Cl1B), which were refined in the ratio 70:30. The intercalated water molecules (O1 and O2) were also disordered in a 70:30 ratio.
elements.clean_text: Crystallography. Crystal data and details of the structure determinations are presented in Table . Data were collected at 123(2) K on a Nonius KappaCCD diffractometer using Mo Kα radiation (λ = 0.71073 Å). Absorption corrections (face-indexed) were applied to both 1 (minimum/maximum transmission factors 0.1723/0.3042) and 2 (0.0899/0.2989). Solutions were obtained by direct methods using SHELXS-97, and the structures were refined against |F 2| using SHELXL-97. All non-hydrogen atoms were refined anisotropically. The hydrogen atoms bonded to the nitrogen atoms of the pyridyls in 1, which are involved in hydrogen bonding, were refined freely with isotropic thermal parameters, while no hydrogen atoms were assigned to the water molecules. All other hydrogens in both structures were included at calculated positions but not refined. One of the chloride ligands in 1 is disordered over two positions (Cl1A and Cl1B), which were refined in the ratio 70:30. The intercalated water molecules (O1 and O2) were also disordered in a 70:30 ratio.

Slow diffusion of HgCl2 in n-propanol into a solution of tpt in 1,1,2,2-tetrachloroethane gave colorless crystals of HgCl4·H2tpt·H2O (1). The structure contains HgCl4 2- anions, doubly protonated H2tpt2+ cations, and intercalated water molecules. Crystallographic data are given in Table , while selected bond lengths and angles are given in Table . In contrast to the previously reported structure of Hg(tpt)2(ClO4)2·6C2H2Cl4, in which each mercury coordinates to six μ3-tpt ligands, the tpt ligands in 1 do not coordinate. Instead, two of the three pyridyl nitrogens of the tpt molecules are protonated. One of these protonated pyridyls hydrogen-bonds to the unprotonated pyridyl of an adjoining H2tpt2+ cation (H2···N1 = 1.95(7) Å, N2···N1 = 2.743(5) Å, N2−H2···N1 = 176(6)°), creating a sinusoidal 1D chain (Figure ). The H2tpt2+ cation has been previously reported in the hydrothermally produced (H2tpt)2[Mo8O26]·2H2O compound, the structure of which also contains cations involved in extensive hydrogen-bonding interactions.
elements.clean_text:
Results and Discussion

Slow diffusion of HgCl2 in n-propanol into a solution of tpt in 1,1,2,2-tetrachloroethane gave colorless crystals of HgCl4⋅H2tpt⋅H2O (1). The structure contains HgCl4 2- anions, doubly protonated H2tpt2+ cations, and intercalated water molecules. Crystallographic data are given in Table , while selected bond lengths and angles are given in Table . In contrast to the previously reported structure of  Hg(tpt)2(ClO4)2⋅6C2H2Cl4, in which each mercury coordinates to six μ3-tpt ligands, the tpt ligands in 1 do not coordinate. Instead, two of the three pyridyl nitrogens of the tpt molecules are protonated. One of these protonated pyridyls hydrogen-bonds to the unprotonated pyridyl of an adjoining H2tpt2+ cation (H2⋅⋅⋅N1 = 1.95(7) Å, N2⋅⋅⋅N1 = 2.743(5) Å, N2-H2⋅⋅⋅N1 = 176(6)°), creating a sinusoidal 1D chain (Figure ). The H2tpt2+ cation has been previously reported in the hydrothermally produced (H2tpt)2[Mo8O26]⋅2H2O compound, the structure of which also contains cations involved in extensive hydrogen-bonding interactions.

elements.content: Hydrogen-bonded 1D chains of H2tpt2+ cations in the structure of HgCl4·H2tpt·H2O (1). The hydrogen-bonded HgCl4 2- anions are also shown (only one position of the disordered chloride ligand is displayed). Not shown are the intercalated water molecules or the aromatic hydrogen atoms bonded to carbon.
elements.clean_text: 1  Hydrogen-bonded 1D chains of H2tpt2+ cations in the structure of HgCl4⋅H2tpt⋅H2O (1). The hydrogen-bonded HgCl4 2- anions are also shown (only one position of the disordered chloride ligand is displayed). Not shown are the intercalated water molecules or the aromatic hydrogen atoms bonded to carbon.

The other protonated pyridyl hydrogen-bonds to a chloride ligand of the HgCl4 2- anion (H3···Cl2 = 2.45(7) Å, N3···Cl2 = 3.126(4) Å, N3−H3···Cl2 = 162(6)°). The use of pyridylH+···ClM synthons in crystal engineering has been explored extensively using H2bipy2+ (bipy = 4,4‘-bipyridine) cations and a number of MCl x n - anions. The NH···ClM distance for 1 is roughly halfway between the analogous distances (2.28 and 2.74 Å) reported in the structure of [H2bipy][HgCl4].

The use of pyridylH+⋅⋅⋅ClM synthons in crystal engineering has been explored extensively using H2bipy2+ (bipy = 4,4‘-bipyridine) cations and a number of MCl x   n  - anions. The NH⋅⋅⋅ClM distance for 1 is roughly halfway between the analogous distances (2.28 and 2.74 Å) reported in the structure of [H2bipy][HgCl4].

elements.content: The HgCl4 2- anions are tetrahedral, with the Hg−Cl distances ranging from 2.457(1) to 2.521(1) Å. One of the chloride ligands is disordered over two positions, as are the intercalated water molecules. These water molecules hydrogen-bond to the chloride ligands (O1···Cl1B = 2.50(2) Å, O2···Cl3 = 3.10(2) Å).
elements.clean_text: The HgCl4 2- anions are tetrahedral, with the Hg-Cl distances ranging from 2.457(1) to 2.521(1) Å. One of the chloride ligands is disordered over two positions, as are the intercalated water molecules. These water molecules hydrogen-bond to the chloride ligands (O1⋅⋅⋅Cl1B = 2.50(2) Å, O2⋅⋅⋅Cl3 = 3.10(2) Å).

elements.content: The chains pack such that there are π···π interactions between the pyridyl groups of adjacent chains, with the closest non-hydrogen contact being 3.32 Å. Through this short interaction each H2tpt2+ cation makes contact with two other H2tpt2+ cations, one each from two separate chains on the same side of the original H2tpt2+ cation. The closest contact to another H2tpt2+ cation on the other side of the first cation is 3.53 Å. There are also a number of weak C−H···Cl interactions between the H2tpt2+ cations and the chloride ligands of the anions, with six crystallographically distinct contacts with H···Cl distances in the range 2.61−2.82 Å (the sum of the van der Waal radii is 2.95 Å).
elements.clean_text: The chains pack such that there are π⋅⋅⋅π interactions between the pyridyl groups of adjacent chains, with the closest non-hydrogen contact being 3.32 Å. Through this short interaction each H2tpt2+ cation makes contact with two other H2tpt2+ cations, one each from two separate chains on the same side of the original H2tpt2+ cation. The closest contact to another H2tpt2+ cation on the other side of the first cation is 3.53 Å. There are also a number of weak C-H⋅⋅⋅Cl interactions between the H2tpt2+ cations and the chloride ligands of the anions, with six crystallographically distinct contacts with H⋅⋅⋅Cl distances in the range 2.61-2.82 Å (the sum of the van der Waal radii is 2.95 Å).

elements.content: Reaction of HgCl2 and hmt in MeOH/H2O gave colorless crystals of (HgCl2)2(hmt) (2). Crystallographic data are given in Table , while selected bond lengths and angles are given in Table . The structure consists of slightly bent HgCl2 molecules (Hg−Cl = 2.351(1) Å, Cl−Hg−Cl‘ = 169.57(5)°) and hmt molecules. In addition to the two strong bonds to the chlorine ligands, the mercury atoms also participate in four weaker interactions, giving a pseudo-octahedral geometry.
elements.clean_text: Reaction of HgCl2 and hmt in MeOH/H2O gave colorless crystals of (HgCl2)2(hmt) (2). Crystallographic data are given in Table , while selected bond lengths and angles are given in Table . The structure consists of slightly bent HgCl2 molecules (Hg-Cl = 2.351(1) Å, Cl-Hg-Cl‘ = 169.57(5)°) and hmt molecules. In addition to the two strong bonds to the chlorine ligands, the mercury atoms also participate in four weaker interactions, giving a pseudo-octahedral geometry.

elements.content: 2D (4,4) sheet in the structure of (HgCl2)2(hmt) (2).
elements.clean_text: 2  2D (4,4) sheet in the structure of (HgCl2)2(hmt) (2).

Selected Bond Lengths (Å) and Angles (deg) in 2 a

Hg(1)−Cl(1) 2.351(1) Hg(1)−N(1) 2.735(4) Hg(1)−Cl(1)i 3.105(1) Cl(1)−Hg(1)−Cl(1)ii 169.57(5) N(1)−Hg(1)−Cl(1) 87.09(9) N(1)−Hg(1)−N(1)ii 99.6(2) Cl(1)−Hg−Cl(1)i 79.49(4) N(1)−Hg(1)−Cl(1)i 162.68(9) Cl(1)i−Hg(1)−Cl(1)iii 76.33(4) Hg(1)−Cl(1)−Hg(1)i 100.51(4)

a  Symmetry operations:  (i) −x + 2, −y + 2, −z + 1; (ii) −x + 7/4, −y + 7/4, z; (iii) x − 1/4, y − 1/4, −z + 1.

Two of these weaker interactions are to two cis-disposed hmt ligands (Hg−N = 2.735(4) Å). The hmt ligands, in turn, connect to four HgCl2 moieties, generating puckered 2D (4,4) sheets which lie parallel to the ab plane of the structure (Figure ). The μ4 connectivity of the hmt ligands noted here has to date been seen in only a few structures. Other reported Hg/hmt structures contain only uncoordinated, μ2 and μ3 hmt molecules, with Hg−N bonds ranging between 2.40(1) and 2.740(4) Å.
elements.clean_text: Two of these weaker interactions are to two cis-disposed hmt ligands (Hg-N = 2.735(4) Å). The hmt ligands, in turn, connect to four HgCl2 moieties, generating puckered 2D (4,4) sheets which lie parallel to the ab plane of the structure (Figure ). The μ4 connectivity of the hmt ligands noted here has to date been seen in only a few structures. Other reported Hg/hmt structures contain only uncoordinated, μ2 and μ3 hmt molecules, with Hg-N bonds ranging between 2.40(1) and 2.740(4) Å.

elements.content: The sheets stack along the c axis such that the HgCl2 molecules of adjoining sheets associate to form chains through long (3.105(1) Å) Hg···Cl interactions (Figure ), generating an overall 3D network. These interactions complete the pseudo-octahedral geometry of the mercury, with each HgCl2 associating with two others in the adjoining sheet via two rhombohedral (Hg−Cl···Hg−Cl···) motifs.
elements.clean_text: The sheets stack along the c axis such that the HgCl2 molecules of adjoining sheets associate to form chains through long (3.105(1) Å) Hg⋅⋅⋅Cl interactions (Figure ), generating an overall 3D network. These interactions complete the pseudo-octahedral geometry of the mercury, with each HgCl2 associating with two others in the adjoining sheet via two rhombohedral (Hg-Cl⋅⋅⋅Hg-Cl⋅⋅⋅) motifs.

elements.content: Adjacent sheets in the structure of2, viewed side-on, linked by 1D chains of weak Hg−Cl interactions running across the page.
elements.clean_text: 3  Adjacent sheets in the structure of2, viewed side-on, linked by 1D chains of weak Hg-Cl interactions running across the page.

elements.content: Although the Hg−N and longer Hg−Cl interactions are considerably weaker than the short Hg−Cl bonds, they are still considerably less than the sums of the van der Waals radii for the respective elements involved (Hg, 1.73 Å; N, 1.55 Å; Cl, 1.75 Å) and thus represent significant interactions. Such interactions have also been noted recently in other mercury/chloride structures.
elements.clean_text: Although the Hg-N and longer Hg-Cl interactions are considerably weaker than the short Hg-Cl bonds, they are still considerably less than the sums of the van der Waals radii for the respective elements involved (Hg, 1.73 Å; N, 1.55 Å; Cl, 1.75 Å) and thus represent significant  interactions. Such interactions have also been noted recently in other mercury/chloride structures.

cln_elements.content:
Synthesis of HgCl 4 ·H 2 tpt·H 2 O (1). A buffer zone containing n-propanol (5 mL) and 1,1,2,2-tetrachloroethane (5 mL) was carefully layered on a solution of tpt (25 mg, 0.08 mmol) in 1,1,2,2-tetrachloroethane (5 mL). A third solution of HgCl2 (22 mg, 0.08 mmol) in n-propanol (5 mL) was then carefully layered on top of the buffer layer. After several days, clear colorless crystals formed (22 mg, 40%). IR (KBr, cm-1):  3486 (m), 3074 (m), 1548 (s), 1505 (vs), 1373 (vs), 800 (s). Anal. Calcd for C18H16Cl4HgN6O:  C, 32.04; H, 2.39; N, 12.45. Found:  C, 31.16; H, 1.95; N, 12.30.

Synthesis of (HgCl 2 ) 2 (hmt) (2). Reaction of HgCl2 (224 mg, 0.825 mmol) and hmt (79 mg, 0.564 mmol) in a 1:1 mixture of water and methanol (20 mL) gave clear colorless needles of 2 (222 mg, 79%). IR (KBr, cm-1):  1460 (m), 1382 (w), 1334 (w), 1233 (s), 1002 (s), 806 (s), 706 (w), 676 (s), 506 (m). Anal. Calcd for C6H12Cl4Hg2N4:  C, 10.55; H, 1.77; N, 8.20. Found:  C, 10.53; H, 1.76; N, 8.23.

Hydrogen-bonded 1D chains of H2tpt2+ cations in the structure of HgCl4·H2tpt·H2O (1). The hydrogen-bonded HgCl4 2- anions are also shown (only one position of the disordered chloride ligand is displayed). Not shown are the intercalated water molecules or the aromatic hydrogen atoms bonded to carbon.
cln_elements.clean_text: 1  Hydrogen-bonded 1D chains of H2tpt2+ cations in the structure of HgCl4⋅H2tpt⋅H2O (1). The hydrogen-bonded HgCl4 2- anions are also shown (only one position of the disordered chloride ligand is displayed). Not shown are the intercalated water molecules or the aromatic hydrogen atoms bonded to carbon.

cln_elements.content: 2D (4,4) sheet in the structure of (HgCl2)2(hmt) (2).
Adjacent sheets in the structure of2, viewed side-on, linked by 1D chains of weak Hg−Cl interactions running across the page.
